snippet: Barbara Byrd-Bennett, chief executive of the Chicago Public Schools, will take a paid leave of absence amid a federal investigation into a $20.5 million no-bid contract the district awarded.
abstract: Chicago Public Schools chief executive Barbara Byrd-Bennett will take paid leave of absence as federal investigation gets underway into $20.5 million no-bid contract awarded by district to training academy for which she did contract work; Byrd-Bennett is not accused of any wrongdoing.
lead_paragraph: Barbara Byrd-Bennett, chief executive of the Chicago Public Schools, will take a paid leave of absence amid a federal investigation into a $20.5 million no-bid contract the district awarded.
